div.head: To the Courteous Reader, and gentle peruser.
div.p: TO make too long an explanation of the worth of the Author, or to commend the Worke with Eloquent words, were but to delay the time, and dull thy expectation: It is a Comedy which hath bin often acted, and so well approved; that I hope none will dislike of it now in the reading: But the Poem it selfe, being now an Orphant, and wanting the Father which first begot it, craves a Patronage from thy gentle acceptance: my hopes are, it will prove no lesse pleasing to the Reader, than it hath formerly beene to the Spectators; and so I leave it to thy charitable Censure.
